pr_title: [GEOT-2425] Change from webdav to nexus repository

timeline.message: [GEOT-2425] Change from webdav to nexus repository
Remove geosolutions repo (nexus now mirrors it)

timeline.bodyText: Does this id name need to be different from the release repo above? geotools-release and geotools-snapshot for example?
timeline.author: jodygarnett
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2317,16 +2300,16 @@
 
   <distributionManagement>
     <repository>
+      <id>nexus</id>
+      <name>OSGeo Release Repository</name>
+      <url>https://repo.osgeo.org/repository/geotools-releases/</url>
       <uniqueVersion>false</uniqueVersion>
-      <id>osgeo</id>
-      <name>Open Source Geospatial Foundation - WebDAV upload</name>
-      <url>dav:http://download.osgeo.org/upload/geotools/</url>
     </repository>
     <snapshotRepository>
-        <id>boundless</id>
-        <uniqueVersion>false</uniqueVersion>
-        <name>Boundless Snapshot Repository</name>
-        <url>https://repo.boundlessgeo.com/snapshot/</url>
+      <id>nexus</id>

replies.bodyText:
@tbarsballe I would like to use consistent naming for these repositories to make the documentation easier to follow.
Can we make the change now?
replies.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText: I have not setup any specific plugin repository, not sure if it is needed?
timeline.author: jodygarnett
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2395,21 +2392,13 @@
         <enabled>false</enabled>
       </snapshots>
     </pluginRepository>
-    <pluginRepository>
-      <id>osgeo</id>
-      <name>Open Source Geospatial Foundation Maven 2 Repository</name>
-      <url>http://download.osgeo.org/webdav/geotools/</url>
-      <releases>
-        <enabled>true</enabled>
-      </releases>
-    </pluginRepository> 
     <pluginRepository>
       <snapshots>
         <enabled>true</enabled>
       </snapshots>
-      <id>boundless</id>
-      <name>Boundless Maven Repository</name>
-      <url>https://repo.boundlessgeo.com/snapshot/</url>
+      <id>osgeo</id>
+      <name>OSGeo Nexus Maven Repository</name>
+      <url>https://repo.osgeo.org/repository/snapshot/</url>

timeline.message: Remove travis cache for repo testing

Revert "Remove travis cache for repo testing"

This reverts commit 036298cd8cd065a179e0d46d94e1dfcc0d5a2e69.

timeline.bodyText: This repo does not cache restlet.org so this line could be removed.
timeline.author: jodygarnett
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2365,21 +2338,45 @@
     </repository>
 
     <repository>
-      <!-- Contains snapshot and release (including third-party-dependencies)              -->
+      <id>osgeo-releases</id>
+      <name>OSGeo Nexus Release Repository</name>
+      <url>https://repo.osgeo.org/repository/release/</url>
+      <!-- contains release (including third-party-dependences)                            -->
       <!-- Restlet maven Repository (http://maven.restlet.org)                             -->

replies.bodyText:
I ended up with:
      <!-- Contains releases for OSGeo projects: GeoTools, GeoWebCache, GeoServer, ...     -->
      <!-- Includs third-party-dependences, and caches of:                                 -->
      <!-- ucar (https://artifacts.unidata.ucar.edu/content/repositories/unidata-releases) -->
      <!-- geosolutions (http://maven.geo-solutions.it/)                                   -->
replies.author: jodygarnett

replies.bodyText: From geoserver/geoserver#4165 , we ended up having to mirror restlet, so leaving this unchanged, as it is now accurate, and the repo does cache restlet.
replies.author: tbarsballe

timeline.bodyText: Apparently unqiueversion is ignored for maven 3 and this line can be removed.
timeline.author: jodygarnett
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2317,16 +2300,16 @@
 
   <distributionManagement>
     <repository>
+      <id>nexus</id>
+      <name>OSGeo Release Repository</name>
+      <url>https://repo.osgeo.org/repository/geotools-releases/</url>
       <uniqueVersion>false</uniqueVersion>
-      <id>osgeo</id>
-      <name>Open Source Geospatial Foundation - WebDAV upload</name>
-      <url>dav:http://download.osgeo.org/upload/geotools/</url>
     </repository>
     <snapshotRepository>
-        <id>boundless</id>
-        <uniqueVersion>false</uniqueVersion>
-        <name>Boundless Snapshot Repository</name>
-        <url>https://repo.boundlessgeo.com/snapshot/</url>
+      <id>nexus</id>
+      <uniqueVersion>false</uniqueVersion>

replies.bodyText: On that note, I noticed that all our nexus repos are "maven2" repositories. Do you know if that would effect anything, even if the build is done with a maven 3 release?
replies.author: tbarsballe
